text: butternut squash and sage really is a
match made in heaven and a wonderful way
to use it in the fall is with pasta
start by trimming the top and bottom
flat and then a little trick for getting
into this thing go from the middle
straight down and down like that and
then repeat on the other side you're
probably used to scraping out these
seeds and pulp from the center and
discarding them but they're absolutely
delicious and I'm including them in this
pasta dish really scrape it all out
okay now with a peeler straight down you
may have to go over this once or twice
to get down to the bright orange flesh
to make it life easy cut this crosswise
first about half an inch thick and I
want to take a little bit of time here
and make sure that I'm cutting
relatively uniform pieces so that they
all cook together at the same time you
only need four cups here and you can
always wrap the rest and use it for
something else
that should do it let's get cooking for
the seeds and pulp have a skillet
preheated over medium heat and give it
two tablespoons of oil and the seeds and
pulp go right in these will take about
ten minutes until the seats puff and
become golden and the flesh will turn
brown and while that does its thing just
before you add the pasta generously
season with salt at least two to three
big pinches and the pasta goes in that's
12 ounces save one cup of pasta water
our seeds are plump and golden and
fragrant and you can see that the flesh
is really shrunk shriveled even and
turned brown so get all of those out of
the pan two tablespoons of unsalted
butter and as soon as that melts we're
gonna add our sage leaves and we're
gonna fry about a quarter cup of lightly
packed sage leaves and these will fry
and crisp up in about one to two minutes
it's very fast these can go right under
the plate with the seeds
and season generously with salt the
squash can go in now
pop on the lid at this point this will
be about 10 minutes mmm looking good
it's tender and ready for making sauce
that pasta watery reserved start with
half a cup this is going to make the
base of our sauce a tablespoon of
unsalted butter and the pasta that goes
right in once this comes up to a simmer
and thickens we'll be ready to bring it
to the table now to plate pasta first
remember those seeds in that pulp that's
a beautiful little garnish fresh ricotta
some crispy pan-fried sage leaves and
the finishing touch poppy seeds and a
drizzle of olive oil to finish and now
we are finally ready enjoy
you
